Private Offering.definition: the sale of an issue of securities directly by the issuer to one or a few large investors without any public offering called also private placement compare public offering NOTE

1.1: the sale of an issue of securities directly by the issuer to one or a few large investors without any public offering called also
1.note: A private offering is exempt from the requirements of filing a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission and distributing prospectuses to potential buyers before the sale.
